properties.description: Samuel Adams and the Sons of Liberty led American colonists in boarding British ships and dumping 342 chests of tea into Boston Harbor.
The Tea Act of 1773, which granted the British East India Company a monopoly on tea sales in the American colonies, was passed.

The mechanism through which the Tea Act led to rebellion: (1) Tea Act imposed taxation without colonial representation; (2) This created economic pressure on local merchants and ideological mobilization; (3) Sons of Liberty channeled discontent into organized resistance; (4) Resistance culminated in direct action against British property.
